info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 04 at 7:47PM CDT until June 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN CROSBY, NORTHWESTERN DICKENS AND SOUTH CENTRAL MOTLEY COUNTIES... At 747 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area earlier this evening. The heaviest precipitation has moved out of the warned area. The West Texas Mesonet at McAdoo recorded 0.52 inches of rain in 10 minutes at 7 PM. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mcadoo and Afton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
